c74object.name: abc.hoa.map~
c74object.description:
abc.hoa.map~ enable you to encode multiple sources in ambisonic in polar coordinate. In contrary of the abc.hoa.encoder~, the user can change the distance between the sweet-spot and the source.
Each input of this object corresponds to a multichannel signal which combine the signal source and his polar coordinate [sig, radian, meter].
For example, if the user spatialize 2 sources (e.g. using @sources 2), the object will have 2 inputs. The first input will wait a 3 channels mc signal corresponding to the signal of the first source and his polar coordinates. The second input will wait a 3 channels mc signal corresponding to the signal of the second source and his polar coordinates.

inlet.description: signal and his polar coordinates [sig, radian, meter]

objarg.name: ambisonic-order
objarg.description: first argument is the ambisonic order [init=1:min=1:max=7:step=1].
